title: Getting Started with docxreview
text: common workflow reproducible reporting looks like : Write report Quarto (.qmd) R Markdown (.Rmd). Render .docx review. reviewer opens Word document, adds comments tracked changes. receive reviewed .docx manually work comment change update source document. Step 4 tedious, error-prone, doesn’t scale well multiple reviewers involved. docxreview automates extraction reviewer feedback can focus revising source.

title: Getting Started with docxreview
text: Render Quarto R Markdown source Word:

title: Getting Started with docxreview
text: Send .docx reviewer. add comments tracked changes (insertions deletions) using Word’s built-review tools. special setup required end.

title: Getting Started with docxreview
text: receive reviewed document, use extract_review() get structured Markdown summary: prints Markdown-formatted summary console: save output file:
code: library(docxreview)  extract_review("report_reviewed.docx") # Review Feedback: report_reviewed.docx  ## Comments (1)  ### 1. Max Mustermann (2024-01-15) > **Marked text:** "the primary endpoint was overall survival" > **Paragraph:** "In this study, the primary endpoint was overall survival."  **Comment:** Should we also mention secondary endpoints here?  ---  ## Tracked Changes (2)  ### 1. [Deletion] Max Mustermann (2024-01-15) > **Deleted:** "approximately" > **Paragraph:** "The sample size was ~~approximately~~ 200 patients."  ---  ### 2. [Insertion] Max Mustermann (2024-01-15) > **Inserted:** "statistically significant" > **Paragraph:** "The difference was **statistically significant** (p < 0.05)."  --- extract_review("report_reviewed.docx", output = "feedback.md")

title: Getting Started with docxreview
text: filtering processing, use individual extraction functions return tibbles: can filter manipulate tibbles standard dplyr operations:
code: # Extract comments as a tibble comments <- extract_comments("report_reviewed.docx") comments # A tibble: 1 x 6   comment_id author          date       comment_text   commented_text  paragraph_context   <chr>      <chr>           <chr>      <chr>          <chr>           <chr> 1 1          Max Mustermann  2024-01-15 Should we ...  the primary ... In this study, ... # Extract tracked changes as a tibble changes <- extract_tracked_changes("report_reviewed.docx") changes # A tibble: 2 x 6   change_id type      author          date       changed_text            paragraph_context       <int> <chr>     <chr>           <chr>      <chr>                   <chr> 1         1 deletion  Max Mustermann  2024-01-15 approximately           The sample size ... 2         2 insertion Max Mustermann  2024-01-15 statistically signifi~ # Filter changes by a specific reviewer dplyr::filter(changes, author == "Max Mustermann")  # Show only deletions dplyr::filter(changes, type == "deletion")

title: Getting Started with docxreview
text: Save Markdown output directly file archiving processing:

title: Getting Started with docxreview
text: docxreview designed work seamlessly Claude Code btw MCP server. enables fully assisted review workflow: btw provides Claude Code access R session. docxreview extracts review feedback. Claude Code reads feedback helps revise .qmd source.

title: Getting Started with docxreview
text: Make docxreview skill available Claude Code adding skill directory project. Find path :

title: Getting Started with docxreview
text: btw running MCP server, can ask Claude Code: “Extract review feedback report_reviewed.docx help revise report.qmd accordingly.” Claude Code use extract_review() read feedback, understand comments tracked changes context, suggest concrete edits Quarto source.

what: Extract Review Feedback from Word Documents
title: Extract Review Feedback from Word Documents
text: docxreview extracts comments tracked changes reviewed Word documents (.docx) returns structured data formatted Markdown. designed workflows documents rendered Quarto R Markdown, reviewed Microsoft Word, feedback needs processed programmatically — particularly Claude Code btw AI-assisted review processing.

title: Extract Review Feedback from Word Documents
text: Install development version GitHub:

title: Extract Review Feedback from Word Documents
code: library(docxreview)  # Get a formatted Markdown summary of all review feedback extract_review("report_reviewed.docx")  # Save to file extract_review("report_reviewed.docx", output = "feedback.md")  # Programmatic access as tibbles comments <- extract_comments("report_reviewed.docx") changes  <- extract_tracked_changes("report_reviewed.docx")

title: Extract Review Feedback from Word Documents
text: typical use case Quarto/R Markdown review cycle: Render Quarto R Markdown document .docx. Send .docx reviewer adds comments tracked changes Microsoft Word. Extract feedback extract_review() get structured Markdown summary comments, insertions, deletions — including paragraph context. Revise source document based extracted feedback.
code:
flowchart LR     A["`.qmd`
Source"] -->|"quarto render"| B["`.docx`
Report"]     B -->|"send to reviewer"| C["Reviewer
edits in Word"]     C -->|"reviewed .docx"| D["{docxreview}
extracts feedback"]     D -->|"structured
Markdown"| E["Author
revises source"]

title: Extract Review Feedback from Word Documents
text: docxreview ships Claude Code skill file inst/skills/docxreview/SKILL.md. used together btw MCP server, Claude Code can automatically extract process review feedback .docx files. make skill available, add installed package’s skill directory project’s .claude/settings.json: find path programmatically:

text: See vignette("docxreview") full workflow documentation.

what: docxreview: Extract Review Feedback from Word Documents — docxreview-package
title: docxreview: Extract Review Feedback from Word Documents — docxreview-package
text: Extract comments tracked changes reviewed Word documents (.docx) return structured data formatted Markdown. Designed workflows documents rendered Quarto R Markdown, reviewed Microsoft Word, feedback needs processed programmatically — particularly Claude Code btw AI-assisted review processing.

title: docxreview: Extract Review Feedback from Word Documents — docxreview-package
text: Maintainer: Paul Schmidt paul.schmidt@biomath.de [copyright holder]

what: Extract comments from a Word document — extract_comments
title: Extract comments from a Word document — extract_comments
text: Reads .docx file extracts comments including commented (highlighted) text, comment text, author, date, full paragraph context comment anchored.

title: Extract comments from a Word document — extract_comments
Extract comments from a Word document — extract_comments
text: docx_path Path .docx file.

title: Extract comments from a Word document — extract_comments
text: tibble::tibble columns: comment_id: Character. comment ID document. author: Character. Name comment author. date: Character. ISO 8601 timestamp comment. comment_text: Character. comment body text. commented_text: Character. text range highlighted/selected. paragraph_context: Character. Full text paragraph(s) containing commented range.

title: Extract comments from a Word document — extract_comments
code: # Extract comments from a reviewed document if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ comments <- extract_comments("report_reviewed.docx") comments } # }

what: Extract all review feedback from a Word document — extract_review
title: Extract all review feedback from a Word document — extract_review
text: Extracts comments tracked changes reviewed .docx file returns structured Markdown summary. main entry point processing reviewer feedback.

title: Extract all review feedback from a Word document — extract_review
Extract all review feedback from a Word document — extract_review
text: docx_path Path .docx file. output Optional file path write Markdown output . NULL (default), Markdown string returned invisibly printed console.

title: Extract all review feedback from a Word document — extract_review
text: Invisibly returns Markdown string. output specified, Markdown also written file.

title: Extract all review feedback from a Word document — extract_review
code: # Print review feedback to console if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ extract_review("report_reviewed.docx")  # Save to file extract_review("report_reviewed.docx", output = "feedback.md") } # }

what: Extract tracked changes from a Word document — extract_tracked_changes
title: Extract tracked changes from a Word document — extract_tracked_changes
text: Reads .docx file extracts tracked changes (insertions deletions) including changed text, author, date, full paragraph context.

title: Extract tracked changes from a Word document — extract_tracked_changes
Extract tracked changes from a Word document — extract_tracked_changes
text: docx_path Path .docx file.

title: Extract tracked changes from a Word document — extract_tracked_changes
text: tibble::tibble columns: change_id: Integer. Sequential ID change. type: Character. Either "insertion" "deletion". author: Character. Name person made change. date: Character. ISO 8601 timestamp change. changed_text: Character. text inserted deleted. paragraph_context: Character. Full text containing paragraph, change marked (~~deletion~~ insertion).

title: Extract tracked changes from a Word document — extract_tracked_changes
code: # Extract tracked changes from a reviewed document if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ changes <- extract_tracked_changes("report_reviewed.docx") changes } # }

title: docxreview 0.0.0.9000
text: Initial development version. Added extract_comments() extract comments paragraph context. Added extract_tracked_changes() extract insertions deletions paragraph context. Added extract_review() combine formatted Markdown output.
